snippet: Only a third of banks were found to require companies they do business with to notify them of a breach. The outside companies include everything from data providers to cleaning crews.
abstract: New York State Dept of Financial Services superintendent Benjamin M Lawsky says survey of 40 banks has found that they are not diligent enough about oversight of cybersecurity protocols at outside firms with which they do business; survey finds numerous lapses, but Lawsky says institutions have time to improve their oversight, underscoring importance of ratcheting up security for everyone involved.
lead_paragraph: Only a third of banks were found to require companies they do business with to notify them of a breach. The outside companies include everything from data providers to cleaning crews.

headline.main: Wall St. Is Told to Tighten Digital Security of Partners
headline.print_headline: Wall St. Is Told to Tighten Digital Security of Partners
